result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles E Burrell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Charles E Burrell
parties.address: PO Box 3530, Oshkosh Correctional Institution, Oshkosh, WI 54903

parties.name: Dane County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: IMPOSED & STAYED. Consec to 12CF2221.  Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.

$278 to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.  $250 DNA surcharge remitted.
Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: 4/7/15: JOC corrected to reflect 6 mo jail as a condition of probation, stayed. DOC may request the court to lift the stay in full or in part depending upon the def's performance on supervision.
